There are multiple CS programs available at the University of Regina. We offer B. Sc. in Computer Science for undergraduate, as well as M. Sc. and PhD for graduate students. Which program would you like to know about?
There are 40 courses required for the completion of the undergrad program.
To graduate with a B Sc in Computer Science, you need to complete 40 courses.
There are 3 routes for the M Sc Program: Thesis, Course and Project Route
To graduate with an M Sc, you can choose one of Thesis, Course, or Project route
After your masters, you can pursue your PhD that involves 9 credit hours of courses and 51 credit hours of research.
To complete the PhD requirements, the student must complete 9 credit hours of courses and 51 credit hours of research.
